title: ISic000174. Funerary epitaph for Euplia
body:
Facsimile Images

D(is) m(anibus) s(acrum)
Euplia ((ivy-leaf)) vị-
xit ((ivy-leaf)) an(nis) ((Ↄ))(circiter) LV

Apparatus criticus

Text from autopsy; Ferrua: D·M·
line.3: Ferrua: IV

English translation

Sacred to the shades of the underworld. Euplia lived approximately 55 years.

commentary

The interpretation of the reversed C before the age is uncertain, but Bivona reasonably suggests that here, as in several other Termini inscriptions, the symbol stands for 'circiter'. Ferrua seems to have read the stone at speed, misreporting line 1, and reading 'IV' for the final numeral. The latter is entirely possible from the ambiguity of of I and L in this style of lettering, but the use of circiter before IV seems unlikely.

bibliography

  • 1977.0341 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001283
  • 95 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002137
  • Fiorelli NSA 1883 179 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10001392
  • VIII 704 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002649
  • Ferrua 1941 262 no.24 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10002655
